snippet: At Chrysler’s current rate of repairs, regulators wrote, it will take 4.7 years to fix all of the recalled Grand Cherokees and two years to fix the Liberty models.
abstract: National Highway Traffic Safety Administration says Chrysler is taking too long to repair 1.6 million recalled Jeep sport utility vehicles; says at automaker's current rate of repairs, it will take 4.7 years to fix all of the recalled Grand Cherokees and two years to fix the Liberty models.

byline.original: By CHRISTOPHER JENSEN and AARON M. KESSLER

lead_paragraph: At Chrysler’s current rate of repairs, regulators wrote, it will take 4.7 years to fix all of the recalled Grand Cherokees and two years to fix the Liberty models.

headline.main: Regulators Criticize Chrysler for Delay in Repairing Recalled Jeeps
headline.print_headline: Regulators Criticize Chrysler for Delay in Repairing Recalled Jeeps
